data.meta_description: Shaun Livingston, an American professional basketball player, is a well-known person. Shaun Livingston is a well-known NBA player who now plays for the Golden State Warriors (NBA). He also wears the number 34 on his jersey and plays as a point guard and shooting guard.
data.text:
Shaun Livingston, an American professional basketball player, is a well-known person. Shaun Livingston is a well-known NBA player who now plays for the Golden State Warriors (NBA). He also wears the number 34 on his jersey and plays as a point guard and shooting guard.

Quick Facts

Full Name:Shaun LivingstonBorn Date:11 Sep, 1985Age:38 yearsHoroscope:VirgoLucky Number:7Lucky Stone:SapphireLucky Color:GreenBest Match for Marriage:Taurus, CapricornGender:MaleProfession:Basketball PlayerCountry:USAHeight:6 feet 5 inches (1.96m)Marital Status:marriedWifeJoanna WilliamsNet Worth$10 millionEye ColorBlackHair ColorBlackBirth PlaceIllinoisNationalityAmericanEthnicityAfrican-AmericanEducationPeoria Central High SchoolFatherReggie LivingstonMotherAnn WymanKids(one) Maria Tyler

Shaun Livingston Biography

Shaun Livingston is a 38-year-old professional basketball player from the United States. He was born in Peoria, Illinois, on September 11, 1985. Shaun Patrick Livingston is his given name, and Virgo is his zodiac sign. Reggie Livingston is his fatherâs name, and Ann Wyman is his motherâs.

Sarah Aupperle-Livingston and Blair Wyman were his two sisters when he was growing up. He also belongs to the African-American ethnicity and nationality in the United States. Basketball has always piqued his curiosity since he was a kid.

Shi attended Richwoods High School, according to his educational history. He then moved on to Peoria Central High School, where he was named Illinois Mr. Basketball in 2004. He had intended to attend Duke University but instead chose to join the 2004 NBA draft instead.

Shaun Livingston Height and Weight

Shaun Livingston has a beautiful figure and a lovely personality. He stands about 6 feet 7 inches tall and weighs around 87 kilograms. There is, however, no information on his physique measurements. In addition, he has black hair and black eyes.

Career

When it comes to Shaunâs professional career, he began playing basketball professionally after being selected by the Los Angeles Clippers in the NBA draft in 2004. In terms of statistics, during the 2005-06 season, he set a career-high with 14 assists in a game against the Golden State Warriors on February 23, 2007.

He then suffered a knee injury in a game against the Charlotte Bobcats on February 26, 2007, which required him to miss multiple games. In October 2008, he signed a two-year contract with the Miami Heat, but on January 7, 2009, he returned to the Memphis Grizzlies.

On March 7, 2009, he joined the Tulsa 66ers of the NBA D-League, which is owned by the Oklahoma City Thunder. On March 31, 2009, he signed a multi-year contract with the Thunder, however, on December 22, 2009, he was dismissed.

On the same day, he signed a 10-day contract with the Washington Wizards. He resigned with them for the remainder of the season once more. Then, on July 20, 2011, he signed a two-year, $7 million contract with the Charlotte Bobcats. On June 23, 2011, he was traded to the Milwaukee Bucks. He was transferred back to the Houston Rockets once more, but he was released before the start of the season.

He also resigned from the Wizards on November 15, 2012, but was quickly released on December 23, 2012. On December 25, 2012, the Cleveland Cavaliers signed him, and in his first game, he had two points, one rebound, and one assist. He re-signed with the Brooklyn Nets before joining the Golden State Warriors on July 11, 2013.

In addition, on July 11, 2014, he signed a three-year contract with the Mavericks worth $16 million. On July 10, 2019, the Warriors released him. During his free agency, he became innominate.

Then, on September 13, 2019, it was confirmed that he had announced his retirement from the NBA in a post, saying, âAfter 15 years in the NBA, Iâm excited, sad, fortunate, and grateful all in one breath.â Itâs difficult to capture all of the emotions that go into pursuing your aspirations in a caption â he stated. The Golden State Warriors announced Livingstonâs appointment as director of player affairs and engagement on September 15, 2020.

Shaun Livingstonâs Net Worth

His profession has brought him a substantial sum of money. His net worth is estimated to be approximately $10 million as of November 2023. Similarly, his pay is still being reviewed. In 2015, however, his annual pay was $5.3 million.

Shaun Livingston Wife, Marriage

Shaun Livingston is a married man. Shaun married Joanna Williams, his long-term girlfriend. On August 9, 2017, they married and exchanged vows with each other. They are content with one another.

Furthermore, he and his wife married in a covert manner. After attending the celebration, even the guests are aware of their marriage. They appear to be in a happy relationship, as there is no indication that they will divorce very soon. A baby girl has been born to the couple. Tyler Marie was their daughterâs name. Furthermore, aside from his trade rumors, he has not been involved in any rumors or scandals.
